intro: Geranium spathulatum var. affine, commonly known as the broadleaf geranium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It features heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture and produces clusters of pink or red, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in garden settings. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for borders and rock gardens.
